result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Alan Shabaiash

records.addlTxt: 01:07 PM Cases 21CF147, 21CF178, 21CF225, and 22CF33 called together.  Defendant David Alan Shabaiash in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases are on for a plea hearing.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Chapman: global agreement has been reached for def to plead G to Ct 1 of 21CF147, Ct 1 of 21CF178, Ct 1 of 21CF225, and an amended count of misdemeanor battery in 21CF30 (before Judge Anderson, at a later date) all without repeaters, parties requesting PSI, parties free to argue.  State moves to amend the repeater enhancers; Court grants to remove enhancers.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters pleas of Guilt.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of to Counts 1 of cases 21CF147, 21CF178, and 21CF225 and orders a JOC; remaining counts before Judge Mogen and case 22CF32 are DRI. Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Court revokes bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:27 AM Cases 22CF32, 21CF225, 21CF178, and 21CF147 called together.  Defendant David Alan Shabaiash in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF32 was on for preliminary hearing; case is now on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Chapman notes an agreement has been reached for pleas to 1 misdemeanor, 3 felonies, PSI, free to argue.  Requests projected plea hearing. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:06 AM Cases 21CF147, 21CF178, 21CF225, and 22CF32 called together.  Defendant David Alan Shabaiash in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  David Alan Shabaiash appeared by video means with Attorney.  Def appearing from Barron County Jail.  Case 22CF32 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG to misdemeanors.  Prelim wanted within time limits.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.

The defendant must post $10,000 additional cash bond to cover Burnett County cases 21CF225, 21CF178, 21CF147, and 22GF25.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
